io.spine.server.delivery

Class Delivery<I,E extends Entity<I,?>,M extends io.spine.core.ActorMessageEnvelope<?,?,?>,S extends ShardedStream<I,?,M>,B extends ShardedStream.AbstractBuilder<I,M,B,S>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.delivery.Delivery<I,E,M,S,B>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - the ID type of entity, to which the messages are being delivered
    E - the type of entity
    M - the type of message envelope, which is used for message delivery
    S - the type of the sharded stream that is used for the delivery
    B - the type of the builder for the sharded stream
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AggregateDelivery, PmDelivery, ProjectionEventDelivery

    @Internal
public abstract class Delivery<I,E extends Entity<I,?>,M extends io.spine.core.ActorMessageEnvelope<?,?,?>,S extends ShardedStream<I,?,M>,B extends ShardedStream.AbstractBuilder<I,M,B,S>>
extends java.lang.Object
    A strategy on delivering the messages received from the respective bus futher through the entity repository down to to the instances of a certain entity type.

    The delivery process is split into sending and consuming.

    The way of sending and consuming the messages is a joint point for re-routing the messages so that the entity instances are only modified in a single computational node at any moment. Such a processing is based upon a sharding strategy, set for the destination repository.
